articles.title: Trump administration approves nearly $3-billion arms sale to Israel
articles.description: State Department announces sale of bombs, warheads worth $2.04-billion as part of deal
articles.content:
The Trump administration has approved an arms sale worth nearly $3-billion to Israel, bypassing a normal congressional review to provide the country with more of the 2,000-pound bombs that it has used in the war against Hamas in Gaza.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Diplomatic Showdown: Trump and Zelenskiy's Fiery Exchange at the White House
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's anticipated meeting with Donald Trump turned contentious, highlighting deep rifts over the Ukraine-Russia conflict. European allies defended Zelenskiy as he faced criticism and dismissal from the Oval Office. The discord left an essential minerals agreement unsigned, questioning future US-Ukraine relations and military aid.

articles.description: Bitcoin Price Today: The original cryptocurrency tumbled as much as 7.2 per cent to $78,226, bringing its decline from the all-time high reached less than six weeks ago to 25 per cent.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump Pushes For Immediate Russia-Ukraine Ceasefire
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump has called for an immediate ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine. He warned Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to pursue peace or risk losing U.S. support. Trump believes Russian President Vladimir Putin is open to a peace deal, despite Zelenskyy's caution regarding Russian intentions.
